title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Super Bowl Ad

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Super Bowl Ad
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all email correspondence of Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. about the MAHA Alliance Super Bowl commercial which featured Mike Tyson.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mitchell Kotler

title: Opioid Settlement Funds FOIA Spring 2026 McDowell County

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Opioid Settlement Funds FOIA Spring 2026 McDowell County
communications.communication:
Dear Donald Hicks:
Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an
opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that pertain to the allocation of the total opioid settlement funds received by McDowell County, the application that individuals or organizations seeking funding from the county complete, copies of grant applications from individuals or organizations that have been approved to receive these funds, the names of individuals who will review the funding applications, any meeting minutes of county-level officials where the receiving or distribution of county-level opioid settlement funding was discussed, and how much funding has been awarded as of February 1, 2026 and to whom it was awarded. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the way state allocated funds are being spent. I am a student journalist working on a large scale project dealing with the funds allocated to the state of West Virginia from the National Opioid Settlement. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. You can call me at 330-978-8228 or send me an email at jlr00026@mix.wvu.edu. My physical address is 1511 University Ave. Morgantown, WV, 26505. If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you for considering my request.
Sincerely,
Jessica Riley

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of the following public records held by the Pattonville School District:

Regarding the book:

Imogen, Obviously
Author: Becky Albertalli
ISBN: 9780063045877

For the time period of May 1, 2023 to the present:

All emails, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, notes, text messages, draft documents, and written communications regarding the review, evaluation, reconsideration, retention, challenge, or discussion of this title.

This includes both internal communications and external correspondence, including but not limited to communications:
• Between district administrators
• Library media specialists
• School principals
• Members of any review or reconsideration committee
• Members of the Board of Education
• Parents or community members
• Advocacy organizations

All documents reflecting how this book was selected, evaluated, approved, purchased, or added to any Pattonville school library collection, including but not limited to:
• Purchase orders
• Vendor invoices
• Selection criteria or policies applied
• Evaluation forms
• Committee recommendations
• Written determinations related to review or retention

Aggregate circulation data for this title from May 1, 2023 to the present, including:
• Total number of checkouts
• Number of unique borrowers
• Circulation totals by month or semester
• Grade levels of students who checked out the book (aggregated only)

I am not requesting personally identifiable student information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned Alumni

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: NA
communications.communication:

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

title: OGC Legal Assessments regarding OBBBA Section 10107 and Byrd Rule Compliance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OGC Legal Assessments regarding OBBBA Section 10107 and Byrd Rule Compliance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request all agency records from January 1, 2025, to September 1, 2025, including but not limited to formal legal opinions, final memoranda, and correspondence with the Senate Budget Committee, regarding the "Byrd Rule" compliance or "budgetary germaneness" of Section 10107 of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act of 2025 (OBBBA).
Please specifically include:
1. Final legal determinations regarding the USDA’s authority to implement the termination of SNAP-Ed funding via the reconciliation process.
2. Communications sent to or received from the Senate Parliamentarian or Senate Budget Committee staff regarding the "Byrd Bath" rulings issued on or about June 20, 2025.
3. Any Vaughn Index or detailed list of responsive documents withheld under Exemption 5, to ensure transparency regarding the existence of legal disputes over this provision.
I request that a search be conducted at minimum within theInternational Affairs, Food Assistance, and Farm and Rural Programs Division of the OGC, including the records of  Associate General Counsel Gena Kochan and her staff. However, this request is not  limited to this division; please search all offices within the OGC likely to possess  responsive records, including the Office of the General Counsel's immediate front office and the Office of Information Affairs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Lehman

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: BAAQMD ALPR Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to usage of Automated License Plate Recognition (ALPR) technology by the City of San Francisco, including only vehicle-based cameras. This EXCLUDES all ALPR technology belonging to the San Francisco Police Department, and instead focuses on non-law enforcement ALPR systems and technology. For City of San Francisco ALPR technology, we are requesting:

1) NDAs, MSAs, SOWs, and contracts relating to the purchase and maintenance of ALPR systems owned/operated by the City of San Francisco
2) ALPR policies, procedures, guides, and training materials 
3)  The names of agencies and organizations with which the City of San Francisco shared ALPR data in 2025
4) All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods June 1st, 2024 until the date of processing this request (An audit log of ALPR queries, time/date, identity/role, agency, and type of data accessed will suffice). If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. 
5) Any MOU or data sharing agreement which allows San Francisco City ALPR records to be shared or queried by non-administrative city staff (e.g. federal agencies, SFPD, etc.).
6) Any search warrants, subpoenas, or court orders you have received for ALPR data in 2025. 

Previously, I submitted a FOIA to BAAQMD based on finding ALPR cameras on a vehicle with their logo on it. They referred me to the City of San Francisco, stating that you own the vehicle. For more context, you may read my exchange with them and view a photo of the vehicle in question here: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/california-52/baaqmd-alpr-review-189686/

I appreciate your assistance. I'd be happy to chat and provide additional context to aid you in your search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

title: FOIA Request: Congressional Correspondence and Internal Memos Regarding OBBBA Section 10107 (SNAP-Ed Defunding)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All agency records, including but not limited to emails, memoranda, legal opinions, and meeting minutes, from January 1, 2025, to August 1, 2025, regarding the following:
1. Correspondence between the Office of the Under Secretary for Food, Nutrition, and Consumer Services (FNCS) and the Senate Budget Committee regarding the "germaneness" or "Byrd Rule compliance" of Section 10107 of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act of 2025 (OBBBA).
2. Internal USDA memoranda or legal assessments produced by the Office of the General Counsel (OGC) or FNS Leadership discussing the procedural validity of defunding the SNAP Nutrition Education and Obesity Prevention Grant Program via the reconciliation process.
3. Directives from the USDA Office of the Secretary to FNS staff regarding the implementation of SNAP-Ed funding termination following the Senate Parliamentarian’s guidance issued on or around June 20, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Lehman

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Polymarket comms + docs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Polymarket recently announced that it would be opening a free grocery store at 137 7th Ave S. New York, NY 10014 (Source: https://x.com/Polymarket/status/2021964616562258241)

Therefore, pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records (dated January 1, 2026 to the time this request is processed):
- All internal communications—including emails, Slack messages, texts, and Microsoft Teams messages—mentioning "Polymarket" or "Poly market." If your search is case sensitive, please also include "polymarket" and "poly market"
- Any and all documents producted mentioning "Polymarket" or "Poly market." If your search is case sensitive, please also include "polymarket" and "poly market"
- Any communications, including emails and texts, between the Office of the Mayor and anyone working for or representing Polymarket (email domain: @polymarket.com)

I respectfully request that my request is expedited, given the newsworthiness of this new free grocery store, and Mayor Mamdani's policy goal of a city-run supermarket pilot.

I am a news reporter for WIRED (wired.com), so the requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I request that any fees are waived. But in the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

If you need to contact me, you can reach me at caroline_haskins@wired.com, or here. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,
Caroline Haskins

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: RMA Congress Comms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting communications since January 1, 2024  between Risk Management Agency staff and the offices of individual members of Congress; the Senate Subcommittee on Commodities, Derivatives, Risk Management, and Trade; or the House Committee on Agriculture.

I am a reporter for High Country News and seek a fee waiver. If that waiver is denied I am willing to pay $25.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: RMA Program Review Comments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All comments received between August 1, 2020 and December 31, 2020 in response to the following report on alternative recommendations : https://www.rma.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2024-09/prf_alternative_recommendations.pdf.  This includes, but is not limited to, comments emailed to rma.kcviri@usda.gov and comments mailed to the agency.

I am a reporter for High Country News and seek a fee waiver. If that waiver is denied I am willing to pay $25.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias
